Claim Intake

Lesson
objectives

¢ Define the steps of the claim intake process

¢ Explain the different paths for a claim to enter
ClaimCenter

« Use the New Claim Wizard to enter a full
claim

| Gi

Tanya i As a Customer Service Representative, | take a lot of

Customer

Service (J calls each day. There are several different situations for

Representative

entering new claims. The customer may have a lot of
information on the claim, or they may have almost no
information. | must be able to handle both ends of the
spectrum.

| First Report of Injury (FRO) G

@&

First Report of Injury (FROI), or First Notice of Loss (FNOL), is the event in which the
insurer is informed of a potentially covered loss

* FROI/FNOL may also come from external systems

| The claim intake process (1 of 7)

Submit My Claim Now

Automated Claim Setup

Automated Claim Setup

Automated Claim Setup

| The claim intake process (5 of 7)

Automated Claim Setup

| The claim intake process (6 of 7)

Submit My Claim Now

Automated Claim Setup

| The claim intake process (7 of 7)

Submit My Claim Now

Automated Claim Setup

| The intake process: imported claims a

Submit My Claim Now

Automated Claim Setup

| imported FRO! Claims Gi

* Claims imported from an external application must meet certain minimum data
requirements

+ The specific requirements are configurable

¢ Policyholder may include a “note” to the adjuster during claim submission

+ Appears as an activity on the claim in ClaimCenter

e ae, Review Fm,
A> (gist lige, =
f yy

| The intake process: portal claims

Submit My Claim Now

Automated Claim Setup

| Portal Intake Process G&G

¢ Ifaclaim is submitted using a portal application, the submission is handled initially
by the policyholder or an agent

¢ Portal submission process may occur in stages:

1. Policyholder saves claim for later or leaves claim in an incomplete state. The draft claim is saved in
ClaimCenter.

2. The saved claim can be retrieved using the New Claim Wizard if the policyholder calls in and
completes the claim over the phone

¢ Policyholder may include a “note” to the adjuster during claim submission

+ Appears as an activity on the claim in ClaimCenter

| The intake process: New Claim Wizard i

Submit My Claim Now

Automated Claim Setup

Tanya € ©
Customer
Service
Representative

Some customers call with almost all the
information we need to record a complete
claim. Since the customer has a lot of
information, | need to capture as much as |
can to make the experience as quick and
easy as possible.

| Demonstration G

Question G

,~ — What are three ways that a claim can be entered into ClaimCenter?

New Claim Wizard

Question G

,~ — What happens during the automated claim setup?

4
¢
¢

SOD DODD DOO OoDOoOoOoOD

Answer [a

,~ — What happens during the automated claim setup?

4
¢
¢

The claim is segmented
The claim is assigned to a group and user

Activities may be created for work that must be done on the claim

SOOO ODDD DDO ODODDOD DOOD

Question G

ae What is the purpose of segmentation?

¢
¢

SOD DODD DOO OoDOoOoOoOD

Answer [a

ane What is the purpose of segmentation?

¢
¢

Segmentation is the process of determining a strategy for processing a claim. The
result of segmentation is that the claim complexity is determined so that appropriate
assignment can be made.

- SSS SSS SE See
